alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Logan; Scott; Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 11 at 8:56PM CST until January 11 at 10:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Logan County in western Arkansas... Southwestern Johnson County in western Arkansas... Northeastern Scott County in western Arkansas... Central Yell County in central Arkansas... * Until 1000 PM CST. * At 856 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Echo, or 8 miles north of Waldron, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Clarksville... Booneville... Waldron... Paris... Danville... Dardanelle... Lamar... Ola... Mansfield... Magazine... Knoxville... Subiaco... Hartman... Scranton... Ratcliff... Blue Mountain... Lake Dardanelle State Park... Hoyt... Petit Jean River WMA... Midway in Logan County... THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Little Rock. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
